verb.description: Establish the truth or correctness of (something previously believed, suspected, or feared to be the case)
examples: if these fears are confirmed, the outlook for the economy will be dire
the report confirms that a diet rich in vitamin C can help to prevent cataracts

verb.description: Administer the religious rite of confirmation to.
examples: he had been baptized and confirmed

origin: Middle English: from Old French confermer, from Latin confirmare, from con- together + firmare strengthen (from firmus firm).
